visible.title: Greece Opens World’s Largest Floating Solar Farm
visible.summary: Stretching across 220 hectares, the new floating solar array can power 75,000 homes. It shows how water surfaces can generate massive clean power without taking up land.

visible.title: Uganda Launches Electric Bus Fleet in Kampala
visible.summary: Kampala welcomed Africa’s newest electric bus system. The fleet cuts air pollution, lowers costs, and signals a shift to clean transit across African cities.

visible.title: Canada Bans Microplastic Glitter Nationwide
visible.summary: Canada has banned the sale of microplastic glitter, a move expected to reduce harmful particles in rivers and oceans, protecting marine life and ecosystems.

visible.title: South Korea Restores Ancient Forest with Drones
visible.summary: AI-powered drone swarms reseeded 50,000 acres of wildfire-damaged forest. The drones plant trees quickly, reviving ecosystems and helping fight climate change.

visible.title: Brazil’s New Ocean Sanctuary Protects Coral Reefs
visible.summary: Brazil announced a 300,000 sq km marine park to safeguard coral reefs, fish, and marine life — a huge win for biodiversity in the South Atlantic.

visible.title: Scotland Achieves 90% Renewable Energy Milestone
visible.summary: Wind and tidal power now generate nearly all of Scotland’s electricity. This landmark proves a modern economy can thrive on renewable sources.

visible.title: Japan’s “Food Waste to Fuel” Project Expands
visible.summary: Supermarkets in Japan are converting unsold food into bioethanol fuel. The program now powers buses in several cities and is set to expand nationwide.

visible.title: Kenya’s Elephant Population Hits 50-Year High
visible.summary: Kenya reported its elephant population is the highest in 50 years, thanks to strong conservation programs and anti-poaching measures.

visible.title: India Installs World’s Cheapest Solar Panels
visible.summary: A new generation of ultra-thin solar panels has dropped costs to $0.15 per watt. Rooftop solar adoption in India is now accelerating rapidly.

visible.title: NASA Confirms Lunar Ice Drilling Mission in 2026
visible.summary: NASA confirmed a mission to drill into the Moon’s south pole in search of frozen water. Success could support astronauts and future lunar bases.

archive.headline: Rwanda Launches National Blood Drone Network Expansion
archive.summary: Life‑saving deliveries now reach an additional 300 rural clinics within minutes.
archive.why: Cuts emergency wait times and saves mothers and newborns.

archive.headline: Spain Converts Abandoned Rail Lines Into Countrywide Bike Paths
archive.summary: New 'greenways' connect towns with safe, scenic cycling routes.
archive.why: Boosts local tourism and healthy transport.

archive.headline: Scientists Unveil Recyclable Battery That Charges to 80% in 5 Minutes
archive.summary: A new chemistry allows ultra‑fast charging with easy end‑of‑life recycling.
archive.why: Speeds EV adoption while cutting e‑waste.

archive.headline: Community Fridges in Jamaica Slash Food Waste
archive.summary: Neighborhood groups install solar‑powered fridges stocked with surplus food.
archive.why: Feeds families and keeps good food out of landfills.

archive.headline: Finland Opens Free National Coding Curriculum for All Ages
archive.summary: Public platform offers beginner‑to‑advanced courses in multiple languages.
archive.why: Democratizes tech skills and future‑proofs workers.

archive.headline: Sri Lanka Restores 50,000 Wells With Rain‑Recharge Design
archive.summary: Semi‑arid villages retrofit old wells to capture monsoon runoff.
archive.why: Secures water and revives traditional know‑how.

archive.headline: Indigenous Fire Stewardship Reduces Wildfire Risk in California
archive.summary: Cultural burns lower fuel loads and restore native habitats.
archive.why: Blends ancestral knowledge with modern resilience.

archive.headline: Botswana Expands Wildlife Corridors for Elephants
archive.summary: New protected routes reconnect herds across key habitats.
archive.why: Prevents conflict and supports migration.

archive.headline: Brazil Favela Coding Bootcamps Place 5,000 Youth in Tech Jobs
archive.summary: Scholarship program links graduates with partner companies.
archive.why: Transforms local talent into career opportunities.

archive.headline: World’s First Zero‑Waste Stadium Opens in Denmark
archive.summary: Composting, reusables, and on‑site recycling turn match days circular.
archive.why: Shows large events can be low‑impact and fun.

archive.summary: Summary...
archive.why: Reason...

archive.headline: UK region installs 200 new defibrillators after donation campaign
archive.summary: Public spaces across the region will now be equipped with life-saving equipment, thanks to a grassroots drive.
archive.why: More lives can be saved in emergencies through quick access to defibrillators.

archive.headline: UK’s smallest seabird records record breeding season
archive.summary: The little tern makes a remarkable comeback after decades of decline.
archive.why: Conservation efforts show tangible results for biodiversity.

archive.headline: Airport program helps young adults from care find jobs
archive.summary: An employment initiative at a major UK airport secures stable jobs for care-experienced youth.
archive.why: Offers opportunities for vulnerable young people to thrive in the workforce.

archive.headline: California turns canals into solar power corridors
archive.summary: Solar panels are installed over irrigation canals to generate renewable energy and conserve water.
archive.why: Maximizes land use efficiency and supports green energy transition.

archive.headline: Fiji declared free of trachoma
archive.summary: After years of health campaigns, Fiji eliminates a major cause of preventable blindness.
archive.why: Marks a major public health victory for the Pacific nation.

archive.headline: Indoor CO₂ filter system developed for homes and offices
archive.summary: Scientists create a groundbreaking device that can scrub CO₂ from indoor air.
archive.why: Improves air quality and fights climate change at a personal scale.

archive.headline: Sea turtles removed from endangered list
archive.summary: Decades of marine protection efforts result in sea turtles being reclassified to a safer status.
archive.why: Shows that international conservation partnerships can reverse species decline.

archive.headline: Biodegradable shoe made from natural materials launches
archive.summary: A new footwear innovation promises to reduce landfill waste.
archive.why: Represents progress for sustainable fashion.

archive.headline: Father raps bedtime story, goes viral
archive.summary: A father’s rap performance of a bedtime story spreads joy and encourages literacy.
archive.why: Highlights creativity and family connection.

archive.headline: Brazilian favela creates community garden
archive.summary: Residents transform neglected land into a thriving green space for food and pride.
archive.why: Supports food security and local empowerment.

archive.headline: Kenya distributes 10,000 solar lamps to rural families
archive.summary: A program provides renewable energy access and reduces dependence on kerosene.
archive.why: Improves children’s education and reduces health risks.

archive.headline: India launches largest mangrove restoration project
archive.summary: Massive planting campaign will strengthen coastlines and support biodiversity.
archive.why: Protects vulnerable coastal communities against storms and rising seas.

archive.headline: São Paulo records sharp drop in urban air pollution
archive.summary: Electric buses and green corridors reduce harmful emissions across the city.
archive.why: Improves public health and combats climate change.

archive.headline: Bilby returns to Australian outback after 50 years
archive.summary: Conservationists celebrate the reintroduction of this endangered marsupial.
archive.why: Restores ecological balance in arid regions.

archive.headline: Jordan women-led cooperative turns food waste into gardens
archive.summary: Amman project creates jobs while reducing waste and producing fresh food.
archive.why: Empowers women and builds sustainable food systems.

stories.headline: Kenya’s New Forest Belt Stops Desert Spread
stories.summary: A green wall of 20 million trees halts advancing desert in northern Kenya.
stories.why: Protects farmland, boosts rainfall, and restores biodiversity.

stories.headline: Germany Offers Free Public Transit for Seniors
stories.summary: Nationwide program grants unlimited free bus and rail travel to people over 65.

stories.headline: India’s Solar Schools Light the Night
stories.summary: Rural schools install rooftop solar, powering night classes for children.
stories.why: Expands education access where electricity is unreliable.

stories.headline: Chile Protects 1,000 Miles of Coastline
stories.summary: New marine reserve safeguards whales, penguins, and fisheries.
stories.why: Largest ocean protection effort in South America.

stories.headline: Japan’s Robot Farmers Double Rice Yields
stories.summary: AI-driven tractors and drones revolutionize sustainable rice farming.
stories.why: Increases food security while cutting labor strain.

stories.headline: Uganda Opens Pan-African Music School
stories.summary: Kampala campus unites students from 20 countries in African traditional music.
stories.why: Preserves heritage and fuels cultural pride.

stories.headline: Iceland Runs Entire Week on Geothermal Energy
stories.summary: A milestone as the grid supplies 100% renewable energy for seven straight days.
stories.why: Proof renewable baseload power is possible.

stories.headline: USA City Converts Vacant Lots Into Pollinator Parks
stories.summary: Detroit transforms 200 abandoned lots into flowering bee sanctuaries.

stories.headline: Philippines’ Coral Farms Rebuild Reefs
stories.summary: Divers plant heat-resistant corals across degraded reef zones.

stories.headline: Canada Launches Universal Mental Health Hotline
stories.summary: 24/7 service connects every citizen to free mental health support.
stories.why: Makes mental health care accessible nationwide.
